candidates.why: Closest orchestration pattern: minimum execution units, multi-phase analysis, user confirmation, sequential execution, and persisted resumable state.
Also an orchestrator; useful for intent analysis + workflow routing patterns (but executes in main process, not external sequential executor).
Has structured planning phases and artifact expectations that can inform coordinator recommendation output format.
Provides patterns for test-related routing and artifacts that should appear as atomic units in recommended pipelines.
Demonstrates an interactive, multi-phase generator flow with explicit file outputs and step-by-step execution.

selected.why: Selected as the primary reference because it matches the coordinator workflow and state persistence model most closely.

oracle.why: Oracle command doc for gap analysis; do not copy verbatim into spec/outlines.
